answers.answer: Hi there.  I did not have preeclampsia but did have pregnancy hypertension.  I'm sorry you are going through this and I'm sure you are worried as all good mama's would be.  Try not to worry.  They will give you steroids if they think that is necessary to help with the baby and development but 35 weeks is getting close to full term.  so, they will do what they need to for your safety and the babies.I know I wasn't very helpful here but just wanted to reach out and wish you much luck and peace.

question: I've been on bed rest for two weeks now due to high blood pressure. I had an appointment today and my blood pressure was super high but they got it down. My doctor said there is a high possibility of inducing me Wednesday (my next appointment) but I'll only be 35 weeks. Has anyone had their baby at 35 weeks or before? How long was the NICU stay? Was your baby healthy?
title: 35 weeks, help
